Kharādiya Jātaka：The Bodhisatta was once born as a leader of deer．His sister Kharādiyā brought him her son that he might teach him the wisdom of the deer，but the young deer was disobedient and did not attend his lessons．As a result，he was caught in a gin and killed by huntsmen．



The story was told in reference to an unruly monk．Kharādiyā is identified with Uppalavannā．J．i．159f．
